description: Republic of Mozambique, August 8, 2020: the President declared the State of Emergency across the national territory for 30 days until September 6, 2020. Violation will be punished by a penalty of 3 to 15 days in prison. The police will monitor compliance, but the Defense and Security Forces, municipal and local, can also be called in to ensure compliance.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On September 04, 2020, in Mozambique: President Nyusi announced that the state of emergency, will be replaced by a situation of public calamity from September 07, 2020 that will last indefinitely. Failure to obey the regulations can be punished in terms of the legislation on civil disobedience and offences against public health.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

description: All incoming travelers must present a negative test for COVID-19. Travelers arriving in Mozambique will be required to provide proof of negative Polymerase Chain Reaction  PCR -based COVID-19 test results administered in their country of origin within 72 hours of departure.
